resources.string:
0 to 4 : No Depression or just Sad
5 to 9 : Mild Depression
10 to 14 : Moderate Depression
15 to 19 : Moderate to Severe Depression
more than 20 : Severe Depression

This application will be used to detect Depression. \nIn the end we will provide a score and personal recommend activities to help you reducing depression.\nDisclaimer: This is not a diagnosis. This is a screening to give you an idea.
Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on thing, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed
Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way
"做任何事都觉得沉闷或者根本不想做任何事"
情绪低落、抑郁或者绝望
难以入睡，容易惊醒；或相反睡觉时间过多
觉得疲倦或者没有活力
不喜欢自己，觉得自己做的不好，对自己失望
反应迟钝，或者比平常活动更多
有自杀或者自残的想法
нет интереса делать что-либо или трудно
Проблемы с засыпанием или слишком много спать
Плохой аппетит или слишком много еды
Чувствовать себя плохо о себе - или что ты неудачник или подвел себя или свою семью
Двигаться или говорить так медленно, чтобы другие могли заметил? Или наоборот - быть таким беспокойным или беспокойным что вы двигались намного больше, чем обычно
Мысли о том, что тебе лучше умереть или причинить боль себя каким-то образом

This mobile application has been develop to detect depression based on Patient Health Questionnaire 9 (PHQ-9), Inc. No permission required to reproduce, translate, display or distribute. Data collected will be anonymous and will be used for just research related to depression.
This app is for non-commercial use and only used for research purpose.
Have you taken this Depression Test?
请问您有做过抑郁症测试吗?
Have you been diagnosis as Depression?
请问您有被诊断为抑郁症吗?
Go for a thirty minutes walk outside

You have answered in the test that you struggle doing things often, with little pleasure or interest. Walking can help decrease the effects of depression and being active is important for your body to stay healthy, which in return will give you more energy into doing things day to day.
You have answered that you feel down and hopeless often in the test. Listening to music is known to relax a person and clear their mind, creating a positive effect to your mental health.

You have answered that you trouble falling asleep, or sleep too much in the test. Resetting your body clock with going to bed early will help deal with this. Going to bed early and resetting your sleeping schedule is known to effectively decrease levels of depression.

You have answered that you feel tired or have little energy. Sunlight and vitamin D are known to help your body and your health. People who suffer with depression are known to sit at home and not go out, which leads to them losing their required regulation of sunlight to keep healthy and energised. You need some YOU time and have a relaxing time outside.
Wake up early in the morning and eat a healthy breakfast

You have answered that you have a poor appetite or are overeating often in the test. Starting your day early and eating the appropriate food is known to create and appetite and setting a working clock
Look in the mirror and tell yourself “I am special”

You have answered that you feel bad about yourself or you feel that you are a failure or let yourself or family down. Telling yourself every day that you are special, can eventually lead to self-esteem boost and belief in what you say. A person with depression will constantly put themselves down, but by telling themselves the opposite can lead to positive effects.

You have answered that you struggle with concentrating on things. Drawing is known to relax and clear the mind which can help with these problems as it promotes positive thinking about art and creativity.
Go to the library and read a book

You have answered that you feel as if your are moving or speaking too slowly and people have noticed or the opposite – feel so fidgety and relentless. Reading clears the mind and helps with concentration. This is extremely beneficial with the problems the users face from this question. They can become more relaxed while reading.
Talk to someone close and tell them how you are feeling

You have answered that you have thought that you are better off dead, or thinking of hurting yourself. Talk to someone to release these thoughts and avoid yourself from any pain or suffering mentally and physically.
